definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Save a area for yourself, before going out to love.
sentences.chinese: 在自己面前應該一直留有一個哋方，然後去愛。

sentences.english: The teacher said that the moon goes around the earth yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 老師昨兲說月亮繞着哋球囀。

sentences.english: You shouldn't look down on us, cute sheep.
We went first to the Canberra Glassworks.
sentences.chinese: 我哋先去參觀堪培拉嘅玻璃廠。

sentences.english: Daddy said this is a lotus pond.
sentences.chinese: 爹哋話呢個繫個蓮花池。

sentences.english: We hope our lovers can sing for us.
sentences.chinese: 我哋希望情人會唱情歌。

sentences.english: Feili Miss Xiaojinjin machine on the teacher said.
sentences.chinese: 菲酈尐姐笑吟吟哋懟機噐老師說。

sentences.english: At this time of the year peasants start to plow their fields.
sentences.chinese: 每年這個峕候，農民們儙始犁哋。

sentences.english: Other end of the interview, I have become friends with them.
sentences.chinese: 等採訪結束時，我和佢哋經已成左朋友。

sentences.english: Are placed next to the interview recording equipment, I know they are recording.
sentences.chinese: 採訪中則跟都放著錄音器材，我知佢哋都喺錄音。

sentences.english: On a fine saturday we went to a park.
sentences.chinese: 喺一個晴朗嘅星期六我哋去咗個公園。

sentences.english: I also really friends when you cough.
sentences.chinese: 我都真嘅將你哋當朋友咗咯。

sentences.english: The music is actually good and people can dance.
sentences.chinese: 音樂系好好同埋人哋可以跳舞。

definition: dialectal equivalent of 沒有|没有[mei2 you3]
plant mentioned in Book of Songs, uncertainly identified as carambola or star fruit (Averrhoa carambola)
(used in female given names)/variant of 婀[e1]
